Reviews.Title: “A good quality for the money”
Reviews.Author: Jan v Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Some people expect a 5 star quality for a 2 or 3 star price. This hotel is not expensive and for the price it delivers a very good quality. The people at the reception are very nice, willing to help. For example I was there in February 2012 with outside temperatures of minus 14 Celsius. My room was the last of the hotel. Probably the heating was not sufficient with these temperatures to keep the room at a high enough temperature. When I asked for another room I got one without any problems. The continental breakfast is very good compared to the price. I have paid 2x more in other hotels and the quality and choice was less. All kind of bread, eggs, 5 to 6 different choices of meat, cheese and all kind of sweets. I do not favour "Wurst" but even that was present. This hotel lays in one the nice parts of Berlin. Around the corner is the Kurfurstendam with a lot of shops and in the Uhlandstrasse there are a lot of different restaurants with different food at different prices. Connection to other part of the city with U and S bahn, busses is great. All together it is a great buy, value for money and I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Budget and Central Location Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saravanan G
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good and central location for hoilday. Stayed on hotel from Jan 20 to 22 2012. 2 minutes walk to ulhandar metro station and 7 minutes walk to zoological garden metro station(Ubahn,Sbahn,DB). for airport 109 bus to berlin Tegal airport & 109 bus stop very near to hotel(ulhandar metro station). Very neat, tiny rooms, comfortable, clean bath. Very helpful and nice staff. There are many restaurants(Asian, Indian) close by hotel . The breakfast was good. for sight seeing, berlin hop on hop bus very near to ulhandar metro station. for Berlino schonefeld airport,I taken U9 from Kufurstendanm metro station(5 minutes walk from hotel or next stop from ulhandar metro station) and get down U Berliner Sr.(5 minutes) and swtich to U7 bahn towards to Rudow (32 Minutes) last station, get down and catch X7 or 171 Bus(11 Minutes) to Schonefeld airport or another alternative from zoological garden an option(check internet for more information)

Reviews.Title: “Great, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillR79
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of lads on a stag holiday- though I'd like to point out we were not a very 'Staggy' stag (if you catch my drift). The hotel offered excellent value for a basic ensuite room, and a great continental breakfast including great big frankfurters. The location was pretty good- central and just around the corner from a 24 hour cocktail bar (very useful in these circumstances) though they were not too happy with drunken English boys turning up at half five in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TSTraveller74
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location for a city holiday. The room was very simple, just 4 beds and a tv, and the bathroom was in a poor condition. The breakfast was very simple and boring. There is a parking basement in the same building. But there was some atmosphere at the hotel placed in a old building. We did not have any problems with noise, but the rooms wasn't to the street but to a backyard.

Reviews.Title: “Modest, but very good position and very nice stuff”
Reviews.Author: slotravel55
Reviews.Content: We done a lot of research on the hotels, becuse we wanted a practical position, close to the airport (the bus station to the airport Tegel is just on the street - bus 109) and not so far to the fair ITB BERLIN and as we were a bit late for the reservation we had an excellant trip for three days. The position of the hotel is very close Kurfurstenstrasse, close to the shopping area, the museum Story of Berlin, the librarys, we had an excellent dinner at Diener restaurant - typical geramn food just in the street nearby (Grolmanstrasse) and lunch at mr HAI. We were in Berlin for the second time, this time because of the ITB Berlin and will certainly come again.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: White906
Reviews.Content: the location of this hotel was okay.. it was a 10 min walk from the main street. there was a railway bridge 2 mins up the road and it caused lots of noise which was not a good thing at night time. the street was very busy and in the morning the rubbish bin truck made loads of noise which also disturbed our sleep. the curtains in the room were useless, they might as well have no curtains in the room. the bed i was sleeping on was hard and very uncomfortable. the building it was situated in was very old. one of the staff members was nice and spoke good english. i wasnt very happy with the hotel and i wouldnt advise it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, not expensive”
Reviews.Author: HelmutSpeer
Reviews.Content: Small pension between Kurfurstendamm (berliner shopping main street) and Savigny Platz, which make really nice location. Rooms are very simple but quite big and clean, with basic furnishings. Breakfast is really great! With a large choice. This is quiet, not expensive place to stay for one or two days. There is really beautiful staircase in the building.

Reviews.Title: “I would definetely go back there again”
Reviews.Author: KamilaD
Reviews.Content: Nice & quiet place, not far from the city centre with bus/underground just round the corner. Easy to reach from Schönefeld Airport, just follow directions given on the website. The room we've been given (No 11) was clean and equipped in everything we needed to stay there for 2-3 nights. The only thing we would find useful would be a bin in the room not only in the bathroom. Also it gets a little bit noisy every time when you take shower/flush the toilet, it wouldn't turn me off that place though. Buffet style breakfast is included in the price of the room, so you can enjoy it before you start exploring Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't care for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2_travelers_from_Pa
Reviews.Content: I had to drop my Wife off on the street to go in and get our room while I parked in a no parking spot 2 blocks away and waited 10 mins to make sure she would be back out on the sidewalk when I came back to get her. Then I parked near the hotel half blocking an entrance to a car garage. I waited there for about another 10 mins. Then I was very lucky to have someone leave and I moved into their spot right away. The Parking is on the street (not on site) with a parking card they give you to use. You have to let them hold your drivers license or passport until you give back the parking card. Good luck finding one of those tight parking spots if you show up between 9:00am and 6:00pm. I hated leaving my rental car along this busy and crowded street for the 5 nights I booked online and stayed here. It survived without damage though. It is very, very, very busy here! A lot of traffic, tight streets, and pedestrians. When you walk in the (semi-dirty looking) ground floor and the 1st floor are apartments then you get to the hotel part on the second floor. None of the 4 different staff that I talked to while we were there spoke any English but, hey, I'm in Germany and I should speak their langauge. On the 2nd floor it was clean and appears to have been recently painted in the large room we had. The 2nd floor also seemed to be slightly unlevel so watch it if you have too many of those great German beers! We (my Wife and I) came back to our locked room after the 1st day out at 9:00pm. I opened the lock (without any bind, pressure, or force) on the only luggage bag that I had locked before we left and the lock fell onto the floor in 5 pieces??? This lock was new and not defective! It was one of those cheap ones that comes with the American Touristor luggage, but after turning the key, onto the floor went one complete half, the curved locking bar, and the other half was broken into 3 pieces?????????? Nothing that I know of was missing from my luggage or the room. I kept my valuables in the car or with me. I mentioned it to a staff member who took me to a guest's room for interpretation purposes. When he (the guest) opened the door, he was wearing bikini underwear and zipping up his pants (he apologized), in the background in the room was another male in bikini underwear. The man spoke great english and basically the women said it was a family business and doubted the cleaning person or anyone had anything to do with my lock falling apart. So, puzzled and unsure as to why my lock fell into pieces, I accepted her response and went back to my room for the night. Wow, an unsolved mystery!!! The rest of my stay was ok. This hotel is close to public transportation, good food and drinks, shopping, etc. The hotel staff was nice and helpful and the buffet breakfast was great. We only paid 60 euros a night. We both aren't that hard to please and would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “basic, clean, and fun”
Reviews.Author: sacolao
Reviews.Content: Quite large place in a great part of Berlin. Good restaurants and shopping in the area. Breakfast was ample and served until 10 I believe. I had a single with a shower (toilet down the hall) the last week in March and paid 40 euro per night - in cash only....no plastic. A decent and well run place as far as I could tell... single rooms small but for those on a budget...just right. The bus from TXL goes right to it. Ask the bus agent at the airport.. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is definately not what I would call a hostel. It is more like your traditional German Pension. The Russian Women who run it are gorgeous, the breakfast is a hearty spread and the rooms are cheap, clean and spacious. I will definately stay there again when I return to Berlin

HotelInfo.Name: Eden am Zoo
HotelInfo.Address: Uhlandstrasse 184, 10623 Berlin, Germany
